intro: Adnaria villosa, commonly known as the hairy adnaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
